answers.answer: You should never use a print statement in a function definition.
answers.feedback: You may include print statements inside your functions.

answers.answer: You should not have any statements in a function after the return statement. Once the function gets to the return statement it will immediately stop executing the function.
answers.feedback: This is a very common mistake so be sure to watch out for it when you write your code!

answers.answer: You must calculate the value of x+y+z before you return it.
answers.feedback: Python will automatically calculate the value x+y+z and then return it in the statement as it is written

answers.answer: A function cannot return a number.
answers.feedback: Functions can return any legal data, including (but not limited to) numbers, strings, booleans, etc.
